title: Ticket #6092: Job Router job event writing bugs
description:
The Job Router's handling of job event logs has several bugs. These don't affect typical usage of the HTCondor-CE, but do affect other users (any time jobs are submitted by an avenue other than Condor-C).

Here are the issues:

  • The Job Router assumes that the UserLog and DAGManNodesLog job attributes contain full pathnames to files. If a value is a relative filename, it attempts to open the wrong file.
  • The Job Router copies the UserLog and DAGManNodesLog job attributes from the source job to the routed job. In non-sandbox mode, this means events for the routed job show up in the source job's event log files. In sandbox mode, this means that the source job's event log files are overwritten by event log files for the routed job when it completes.
  • The Job Router writes Terminate, Abort, and Hold events for the source job, but nothing else. Execute and Evict events are desired by some CMS folks.
  • If UserLog and DAGManNodesLog are undefined in the source job ad, then no events are written to the global event log.

Generally, the Job Router should handle job event logging similar to how Condor-C does it. It should remove event log file attributes from the destination job ad, and write a fuller set of events for the source job.
